crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SSLBL: Traffic to malicious host (likely LegionLoader C&C traffic)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> [188.114.97.7] 443 (msg:"SSLBL: Traffic to malicious host (likely LegionLoader C&C traffic)"; flow:established,to_server; threshold: type limit, track by_src, seconds 60, count 1; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:904200002; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Device Retrieving External IP Address Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY External IP Lookup ip-api.com
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY External IP Lookup ip-api.com"; flow:established,to_server; http.host; content:"ip-api.com"; classtype:external-ip-check; sid:2022082; rev:6; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2015_11_13, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_11_26, mitre_tactic_id TA0043, mitre_tactic_name Reconnaissance, mitre_technique_id T1590, mitre_technique_name Gather_Victim_Network_Information;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools
Detects file creation events with filename patterns used by CrackMapExec.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Network Communication With Crypto Mining Pool
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects initiated network connections to crypto mining pools
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the load of a signed WinRing0 driver often used by threat actors, crypto miners (XMRIG) or malware for privilege escalation

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=D25340AE8E92A6D29F599FEF426A2BC1B5217299,MD5=0C0195C48B6B8582FA6F6373032118DA,SHA256=11BD2C9F9E2397C9A16E0990E4ED2CF0679498FE0FD418A3DFDAC60B5C160EE5,IMPHASH=D41FA95D4642DC981F10DE36F4DC8CD7; SignatureStatus=Valid; ImageLoaded=C:\Program Files\Google\Libs\WR64.sys; Signature=Noriyuki MIYAZAKI; Signed=true; EventID=6}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=815A050FC4BD12C6CA0B62D38D0FB6F8A95F70A8,MD5=838D346D1D28F00783B7A6C6BD03A0DA,SHA256=8BE433049CCC271F04A8E625E9FB9BD3BCF15B4EDEB63497C00BD9CE1CD5C50E,IMPHASH=7EE4BC5589713B3470B8A950256E2E69; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe <#tugby#> IF((New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) { schtasks /run /tn "GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC" } Else { "C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\updater.exe" }; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /run /tn GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe <#zfjwxc#> IF((New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) { IF([System.Environment]::OSVersion.Version -lt [System.Version]"6.2") { schtasks /create /f /sc onlogon /rl highest /ru 'System' /tn 'GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC' /tr '''C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\updater.exe''' } Else { Register-ScheduledTask -Action (New- [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects loading of known vulnerable drivers via their hash.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects threat actors proxy executing code and bypassing application controls by leveraging wmic and the `/FORMAT` argument switch to download and execute an XSL file (i.e js, vbs, etc).

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.
Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=<#zfjwxc#> IF((New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) { IF([System.Environment]::OSVersion.Version -lt [System.Version]6.2) { schtasks /create /f /sc onlogon /rl highest /ru 'System' /tn 'GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC' /tr '''C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\updater.exe''' } Else { Register-ScheduledTask -Action (New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute 'C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=2c2c21c4-79d8-4b09-889b-392c74aa7712; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=<#zfjwxc#> IF((New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) { IF([System.Environment]::OSVersion.Version -lt [System.Version]6.2) { schtasks /create /f /sc onlogon /rl highest /ru 'System' /tn 'GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC' /tr '''C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\updater.exe''' } Else { Register-ScheduledTask -Action (New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute 'C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=aef42304-3e5d-4773-bf25-979ce523d10b; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Network Connection to IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects external IP address lookups by non-browser processes via services such as "api.ipify.org". This could be indicative of potential post compromise internet test activity.
Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath @($env:UserProfile, $env:ProgramFiles) -Force; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "process" flag, which adversary might use to list processes running on the compromised host or list installed software hotfixes and patches.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=BF0B46AE28A0DCCC62CF1F3C32B60A46EA928C52,MD5=EC80E603E0090B3AC3C1234C2BA43A0F,SHA256=D368BCB7934DB0C53D1E7277DCB47AF2B709253CBF0EEE9869EE7E17ED226EA3,IMPHASH=59A9108CA1CECC9147C5FBAB104EBF33; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=wmic.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=WMI Commandline Utility; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c wmic PATH Win32_VideoController GET Name, VideoProcessor > "C:\Program Files\Google\Libs\g.log"; CommandLine=wmic  PATH Win32_VideoController GET Name, VideoProcessor ; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WMIC.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions
Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.
Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Access To Crypto Currency Wallets By Uncommon Applications
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects file access requests to crypto currency files by uncommon processes.
Could indicate potential attempt of crypto currency wallet stealing.
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe <#zfjwxc#> IF((New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) { IF([System.Environment]::OSVersion.Version -lt [System.Version]"6.2") { schtasks /create /f /sc onlogon /rl highest /ru 'System' /tn 'GoogleUpdateTaskMachineQC' /tr '''C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\updater.exe''' } Else { Register-ScheduledTask -Action (New- [TRUNCATED]; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Raspberry Robin Registry Set Internet Settings ZoneMap
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects registry modifications related to the proxy configuration of the system, potentially associated with the Raspberry Robin malware, as seen in campaigns running in Q1 2024.
Raspberry Robin may alter proxy settings to circumvent security measures, ensuring unhindered connection with Command and Control servers for maintaining control over compromised systems if there are any proxy settings that are blocking connections.

When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution
Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "sc.exe" utility
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=sc.exe; Hashes=SHA1=72785E3068AA52CA223DA466595D3863AB6507AB,MD5=D79784553A9410D15E04766AAAB77CD6,SHA256=AEB241959F4A7B7C29F45D27FD65C5326F9592D25BADD1A7659DE0DA351BF96E,IMPHASH=7D296975925315BE8D57D0C67B133359; Description=Service Control Manager Configuration Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c sc stop UsoSvc & sc stop WaaSMedicSvc & sc stop wuauserv & sc stop bits & sc stop dosvc & reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\UsoSvc" /f & reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\WaaSMedicSvc" /f & reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv" /f & reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\bits" /f & reg delete "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\dosvc" /f; CommandLine=sc  stop UsoSvc ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\sc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
